sentences.english: In the car accident he lost feeling below the waist.
sentences.chinese: 這次車禍使他腰部底下全無知覺。

sentences.english: It is useless attacking the insensible.
sentences.chinese: 攻擊無知覺的東西是徒勞的。

sentences.english: She looked back at Kelly's unconscious form.
sentences.chinese: 她回頭看了看凱麗無知覺的狀態。

sentences.english: A person may become unconscious, not knowing what is happening.
sentences.chinese: 此時人會變得神志不清，對周圍發生的事情毫無知覺。

sentences.english: Let him put handcuffs on the dead and beat them senseless with whips.
sentences.chinese: 讓他銬上死人的手吧，鞭打他們無知覺的屍體吧。

sentences.english: She fell, motionless, onto the road.
sentences.chinese: 毫無知覺地，她倒在了路上。

sentences.english: As to his head, he was conscious of nothing but a feeling of fulness - of congestion.
sentences.chinese: 他的頭毫無知覺但是卻似乎充血腫脹。

sentences.english: Absorbed in her work, she was totally oblivious of her surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 她專心於工作，對周圍的一切毫無知覺。

sentences.english: Sir Henry lay unconscious where he had fallen.
sentences.chinese: 亨利爵士躺在他摔倒的地方，毫無知覺。

sentences.english: Picture my body lying on the ground unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 想像我的身體無知覺地躺在地上。

sentences.english: And no loss of consciousness for more than five seconds.
sentences.chinese: 未出現超過5秒鐘無知覺的現象。

definition: to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
